attributes.action: abandon all measures that would allow any form of secret inquest
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Public inquests are an essential pillar of our freedom and justice. 
However inconvenient to the government of the day (and its agencies), the public must be able to see and review the circumstances of all deaths. Mr Straw's assertion that, if introduced, secret inquests would only be used in a tiny number of cases is either incredibly naive or deliberately misleading. It is inevitable that secret procedures would be justified and used in an ever increasing number of instances.
The only protection for our civil liberties is to allow no exceptions from public scrutiny.
